p: S. commersonii is known to be the most frost hardy wild potato species, being able to tolerate an acute freezing episode of about −5 °C and further acclimate to tolerate −10 °C after being exposed to chilling temperatures for several days [ 6, 87]. On the other hand, Solanum tuberosum cv. Désirée is only slightly able to acclimate to cold, and it is thus rather sensitive to frost [ 26].
